com.hazelcast.internal.memory.impl

Class AlignmentAwareMemoryAccessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.internal.memory.impl.AlignmentAwareMemoryAccessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ByteAccessStrategy<Object>, ConcurrentHeapMemoryAccessor, ConcurrentMemoryAccessor, GlobalMemoryAccessor, HeapMemoryAccessor, MemoryAccessor

    public final class AlignmentAwareMemoryAccessor
extends Object

    Aligned MemoryAccessor which checks for and handles unaligned memory access by splitting a larger-size memory operation into several smaller-size ones (which have finer-grained alignment requirements).

    A few notes on this implementation:

    • There is no atomicity guarantee for unaligned memory accesses. In fact, even on platforms which support unaligned memory accesses, there is no guarantee for atomicity when there is unaligned memory accesses. On later Intel processors, unaligned access within the cache line is atomic, but access that straddles cache lines is not. See http://psy-lob-saw.blogspot.com.tr/2013/07/atomicity-of-unaligned-memory-access-in.html for more details.
    • Unaligned memory access is not supported for CAS operations.
    • Unaligned memory access is not supported for ordered writes.

        x - - byte to write

        Gets the offset of given field.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the offset of given field

      • copyMemory

        public void copyMemory(Object srcObj,
              long srcOffset,
              Object destObj,
              long destOffset,
              long lengthBytes)
        Description copied from interface: HeapMemoryAccessor
        Copies memory from source to destination. Source and destination addresses are specified in the form (baseObject, offset) such that the offset is added to the object's base address on Java heap.
        Parameters:
        srcObj - source object
        srcOffset - source offset
        destObj - destination object
        destOffset - destination offset
        lengthBytes - number of bytes to be copied

      • compareAndSwapInt

        public boolean compareAndSwapInt(Object base,
                        long offset,
                        int expected,
                        int x)
        Description copied from interface: ConcurrentHeapMemoryAccessor
        Compares and swaps an int value to an expected value atomically based by given object with given offset, if and only if its current value is equal to the expected value.
        Parameters:
        base - the object where int value will be written to
        offset - offset from object's base to the accessed location
        expected - the expected current int value to be set new int value
        x - the int value to be written
        Returns:
        true if CAS is successful, false otherwise

      • compareAndSwapLong

        public boolean compareAndSwapLong(Object base,
                         long offset,
                         long expected,
                         long x)
        Description copied from interface: ConcurrentHeapMemoryAccessor
        Compares and swaps a long value to an expected value atomically based by given object with given offset if and only if its current value equals to the expected value.
        Parameters:
        base - the object where long value will be written to
        offset - offset from object's base to the accessed location
        expected - the expected current long value to be set new long value
        x - the long value to be written
        Returns:
        true if CAS is successful, false otherwise

      • compareAndSwapObject

        public boolean compareAndSwapObject(Object base,
                           long offset,
                           Object expected,
                           Object x)
        Description copied from interface: ConcurrentHeapMemoryAccessor
        Compares and swaps referenced object to expected object atomically based by given owner object at given offset if and only if its current object is the expected object.
        Parameters:
        base - the owner object where the referenced object will be written to
        offset - offset from object's base to the accessed location
        expected - the expected current referenced object to be set to new referenced object
        x - the new referenced object that will be written
        Returns:
        true if CAS is successful, false otherwise

      • isAvailable

        public static boolean isAvailable()
        Returns whether memory accessors of type UnsafeBasedMemoryAccessor are available or not.

      • isBigEndian

        public boolean isBigEndian()
        Description copied from interface: MemoryAccessor
        Tells whether this memory accessor is big- or little-endian. This applies to all the multibyte-width methods of integral type (get/putChar, get/putShort, get/putInt, get/putLong declared in this interface and others declared in subinterfaces).
        Specified by:
        isBigEndian in interface MemoryAccessor
        Returns:
        true if the accessor is big-endian; false otherwise
